text: Recursive startups? This sounds like a fun new way to get lost in bureaucracy. Can't wait to see how deep the rabbit hole goes!
It's like Inception for startups. I'm waiting for someone to create a startup that's focused on explaining these recursive startups.
Maybe we should create a startup that creates explanations for the startups created by these recursive startups. It's recursion all the way down!
I can already see the pitch for investors: "Our startups create startups that create startups, which means infinite exponential growth!"
Except, as we all know, infinite growth is not sustainable. At some point, we'll have startups creating startups that create...pizzas?
Nah, it's turtles all the way down, not pizzas.
What would happen if one of these recursive startups creates a startup that also creates recursive startups?
You just blew my mind. It's like a fractal of startups!
I think we've found the solution for perpetual funding. Just create recursive startups creating recursive startups creating...you get the idea.
Has anyone considered the tax implications of this? Each new startup would need its own accounting department, and don't get me started on international regulations...
Recursive startups meet recursive tax forms. The IRS will have a field day.
It's like a never-ending nesting doll of audits.
Recursive startups are people! Or at least, they will be once we run out of ideas for new startups.
I've seen the future, and it's a world where all startups are just startups creating other startups, and nobody does any actual work. It's like the singularity, but for venture capital.
